metadata.Title: CVE-2017-17506 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
In HDF5 1.10.1, there is an out of bounds read vulnerability in thefunction H5Opline_pline_decode in H5Opline.c in libhdf5.a. For example,h5dump would crash when someone opens a crafted hdf5 file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-17506` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

hdf5-helpers - 1.10.4+repack-1
hdf5-tools - 1.10.4+repack-1
libhdf5-103 - 1.10.4+repack-1
libhdf5-103-1 - 1.10.4+repack-1
libhdf5-cpp-103 - 1.10.4+repack-1
libhdf5-cpp-103-1 - 1.10.4+repack-1
libhdf5-fortran-102 - 1.10.4+repack-1
libhdf5-hl-100 - 1.10.4+repack-1
libhdf5-hl-cpp-100 - 1.10.4+repack-1
libhdf5-hl-fortran-100 - 1.10.4+repack-1
libhdf5-java - 1.10.4+repack-1
libhdf5-jni - 1.10.4+repack-1
libhdf5-mpich-103 - 1.10.4+repack-1
libhdf5-mpich-103-1 - 1.10.4+repack-1
libhdf5-mpich-cpp-103-1 - 1.10.4+repack-1
libhdf5-mpich-fortran-102 - 1.10.4+repack-1
libhdf5-mpich-hl-100 - 1.10.4+repack-1
libhdf5-mpich-hl-cpp-100 - 1.10.4+repack-1
libhdf5-mpich-hl-fortran-100 - 1.10.4+repack-1
libhdf5-openmpi-103 - 1.10.4+repack-1
libhdf5-openmpi-103-1 - 1.10.4+repack-1
libhdf5-openmpi-cpp-103-1 - 1.10.4+repack-1
libhdf5-openmpi-fortran-102 - 1.10.4+repack-1
libhdf5-openmpi-hl-100 - 1.10.4+repack-1
libhdf5-openmpi-hl-cpp-100 - 1.10.4+repack-1
libhdf5-openmpi-hl-fortran-100 - 1.10.4+repack-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: hdf5 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.4+repack-1').
